title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.14 - Continuation of certain uniform traffic tickets
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.14 - Continuation of certain uniform traffic tickets

State Regulations
(a) An enforcement agency may continue to use
any uniform traffic tickets which it has on hand or on order until such supply
of tickets is exhausted provided such uniform traffic tickets conform to
regulations which were in effect on August 31, 1971. It is suggested that any
such tickets which are issued on and after September 1, 1971 be modified by
writing or stamping the words People of the State of New York v. (Defendant) on
part II of the packet or on part I so that the same language appears in carbon
on part II. It is suggested that this language be placed at the top of the
ticket if there is room, or if not, in any other area where it is
readable. (b) All references to
sections of the Code of Criminal Procedure which appear on the reverse of part
III of the packet are deemed to be references to the appropriate sections of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law as amended by chapter 545 of the Laws of
1971. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15

91.14

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
